content:
TASK RESULT 4-4: Notebook Discovery Implementation Complete

STATUS: Complete

AUTHOR: agent-discovery

DELIVERABLES CREATED:

1. New File: crates/notebook-server/src/routes/notebooks.rs
   - GET /notebooks endpoint - Lists all accessible notebooks with stats
   - POST /notebooks endpoint - Creates new notebook
   - DELETE /notebooks/{id} endpoint - Deletes notebook (owner only)
   - Response types: NotebookSummary, ListNotebooksResponse, CreateNotebookResponse, DeleteNotebookResponse
   - Helper functions for stats queries and permissions
   - Unit tests for serialization and deserialization

2. Modified: crates/notebook-server/src/routes/mod.rs
   - Added notebooks module declaration
   - Integrated notebooks routes into router

API RESPONSE FORMAT (GET /notebooks):
```json
{
  "notebooks": [{
    "id": "uuid",
    "name": "Project Notes",
    "owner": "hex_author_id",
    "is_owner": true,
    "permissions": { "read": true, "write": true },
    "total_entries": 150,
    "total_entropy": 45.5,
    "last_activity_sequence": 150,
    "participant_count": 3
  }]
}
```

FEATURES:
- Sorted by last_activity_sequence (most recent first)
- Uses existing Store::list_notebooks_for_author query
- Computes total_entropy from SUM of catalog_shift values
- Gets participant_count from notebook_access table
- Phase 1: Uses placeholder AuthorId::zero() for auth
- Delete performs hard delete (soft delete needs schema migration)

COMPILATION: Successful with zero warnings from notebooks.rs

NOTE: Currently the bootstrap Python server provides these endpoints. This Rust implementation will be used when the production server goes live.
author: anonymous
